page.title: 19Biography - A working day
page.content: Interview with Mrs Dolby, Custodian of Kirby Hall. "Before I took this job I was Post Mistress at Deene, until the Post Office closed in 1974. Then I came to Kirby Hall and there's a Custodian's House in the grounds. I work each day, except Mondays, and its my job to see that the site is kept in good condition and there's no litter. I have to see that the visitors behave orderly and don't damage the Hall. I also have to look after the office, taking entrance fees and selling guide books and souvenirs. We have over five thousand visitors each year, mainly between April and August, but in Winter it can be very quiet. I look after everything except the gardens and contractors see to them. A temporary man looks after the office on Mondays when I'm off duty."
